meanings.definition: To make a mess of something; to ruin or spoil.
meanings.sent1: I was ballsing up my room by throwing clothes everywhere.
meanings.sent2: She always ends up ballsing things when she tries to help.
meanings.sent3: He kept ballsing up the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The rain started ballsing up our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent5: The clumsy waiter was ballsing up orders left and right.

meanings.definition: To engage in reckless or foolish behavior.
meanings.sent1: They were ballsing around on the edge of the pool, risking a fall.
meanings.sent2: Stop ballsing about and focus on your work!
meanings.sent3: The kids were ballsing around in the park, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was ballsing through life without a care.
meanings.sent5: The daredevil was ballsing through dangerous stunts for attention.

meanings.definition: A vulgar slang term for testicles.
meanings.sent1: He got hit in the ballsing during the game and winced in pain.
meanings.sent2: The comedian made a joke about ballsing that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The awkward silence followed his accidental mention of ballsing.
meanings.sent4: The boxer protected his ballsing during the match.
meanings.sent5: The doctor examined his patient's ballsing for any signs of injury.
